subject: Self Care
title: IQ vs EQ
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on IQ vs EQ.

hook.text: The highest-IQ person in the room often isn't the most successful. Something else matters more.

buildup.text: Daniel Goleman's research showed that emotional intelligence predicts success better than IQ in most careers.

discovery.text: EQ includes self-awareness, self-regulation, empathy, motivation, and social skills. IQ is just one dimension.

twist.text: IQ is mostly fixed by adulthood. EQ can be developed and strengthened at any age through practice.

climax.text: The smartest move isn't being the smartest person. It's understanding people â€” including yourself â€” deeply.

punchline.text: IQ gets you hired. EQ gets you promoted.

quiz.question: What did Goleman's research show about emotional intelligence?
options: IQ matters more in all cases
EQ predicts success better than IQ in most careers
EQ and IQ are the same thing
